meanings.definition: A device used to separate or disconnect two components.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used decouplers to detach the engine from the car.
meanings.sent2: The technician installed the decouplers to isolate the electrical circuit.
meanings.sent3: The decouplers decided to take a break and let the parts stay apart for a while.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor acted as a decoupler, preventing any tension between the team members.
meanings.sent5: The bright red color of the decouplers made them easy to spot in the toolbox.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that causes a separation or disconnection.
meanings.sent1: The misunderstanding served as a decoupler between the friends.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise acted as a decoupler, disrupting the peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was the unexpected decoupler in the garden party.
meanings.sent4: His absence was a decoupler, leaving a noticeable gap in the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The faulty wire was the sneaky decoupler that caused the entire system to fail.

meanings.definition: The act of separating or disconnecting two components.
meanings.sent1: The decouplers were performed swiftly to avoid any damage to the equipment.
meanings.sent2: The decouplers were necessary to ensure a safe removal of the old pipes.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved a clever decouplers of the linked rings.
meanings.sent4: The decouplers of the power source were crucial before starting the repair work.
meanings.sent5: The sudden decouplers of the train cars startled the passengers.
